title: Encounter (A)
creator_contributor_role: Victoria. Ministry of Aboriginal Affairs, production company
Dept of Agriculture, Vic, production company
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Educational exchanges - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Intercultural communication
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Australia - Race relations
description: Lake Tyers, which has been home to Aborigines for over one hundred years, was the site of a camp for aboriginal and non-aboriginal boys for ten days. Under the watchful eyes of voluntary skilled instructors the boys swam, sailed, canoed, scuba-dived, went hiking, fishing and played the residents at cricket. They made friends and learned teamwork and co-operation. Narrated by David Johnson.
